previousScannedThrough: Dario Amodei + Satya Nadella episodes (triaged full episode list). No new eps since Nov 25, 2025 (on hiatus).
newScannedThrough: Episode 23 (Ben Thompson, Feb 12, 2026). Podcast resumed Feb 2026 after hiatus.

newContent.title: Elon Musk on Space GPUs, AI, Optimus, and his manufacturing method
newContent.notes: xAI team structure (several hundred, engineers not researchers), AI lab critique (revenue-maximizing corps vs real labs), cross-company integration hints (xAI-Tesla convergence with Grok orchestrating Optimus)

newContent.title: An Interview with Ben Thompson by John Collison
newContent.notes: Topics: AI agents impact on ads/e-commerce, whether software is dead, Mark Zuckerberg's platform obsession harming Meta. Meta organizational critique may be relevant.

newContent.title: Julia DeWahl (Antares) on nuclear micro-reactors
newContent.notes: AI hyperscalers driving nuclear renaissance - infrastructure angle. Energy constraints on AI scaling.

summary: Cheeky Pint resumed after ~3-month hiatus with major episodes. Now at 23 episodes. HIGH-relevance Musk episode contains xAI organizational structure insights: framing AI work as engineering not research, team of several hundred engineers, critique of 'AI labs' as revenue-maximizing corporations. Ben Thompson episode covers AI agents disrupting business models. Julia DeWahl episode addresses AI infrastructure constraints (nuclear for hyperscalers).
recommendedAction: Queue Musk episode for detailed curation - xAI organizational structure is directly relevant to specimen collection. Ben Thompson episode may yield Meta organizational insights worth cross-referencing with existing Meta specimen.
